column4: I suppose what I'm asking is whether many linux/ubuntu applications have windows ports or whether there's a wine-esque program for windows that does the same thing but for linux libraries
depends on the app and the devs, you can always port it yourself, the source code is freely available
if all porting refers to is compiling it myself and having it work then, then yeah, that'd be cake
what do you want to achieve and we may be able to suggest apps
I suppose the end goal is to have >75% of the included ubuntu applications installed on windows7
what do you want the apps to achieve?
I don't really know what you mean or how to answer that; the idea is emulating the feel of ubuntu
fidel: http://i.imgur.com/o0nu9.jpg   I've emulated the desktop decently enough for my satisfaction; now i'm just looking for typical/default ubuntu programs (open-source) to install
haha class
Firefox, VLC, Thunderbird, Pidgin, DeVeDe, Libre/OpenOffice, Spotify, Gimp all have Windows ports (Just a list I thought of quickly)
thanks for that :D
depends what you need the app to do.
there is a tweak app for Windows to put the Close, Min, Max buttons on the left too if you want
They're on the left in Ubuntu? o_O (been a while)
could use powershell :)
</3 powershell
oh dude it does a lot if you can use it
yeah, but it feels obtuse
how so?
gotta go for now, changing classes ;D
work is quiet :)
just fyi, busy fooling with the win7 login screen to make it more ubunteque :D
